intro: Verbascum hervieri, commonly known as the desert mullein, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its tall, hairy stems and large, woolly leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Verbascum hervieri is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a hardy, low-maintenance plant.
